there was a video by a youtube chemist on how to extract ECM from any tissue but becuz youtube thinks its all meth the channel and video was taken down.
BUT since i was bored and remembered the steps on exactly what he did i will list it below.
this is costly and time consuming and takes about 1-2 months to remove all the cellular components of the tissue
here is how you extract ECM from any tissue.
you first would need a detergent to burst all the cells and wash them away either sodium lauryl sulfate (SLS) , Sodium laureth sulfate (SLES) , or sodium dodecyl sulfate (SDS), either one you choose will work must be pure and not products containing it like shampoo.
next you would need to obtain some 30% ammonia solution or make it by reacting any amonium salt or urea with sodium hydroxide DO NOT USE URINE.
lastly you either need hydrogen peroxide 30% conc or you can also use sodium percarbonate aka dishwasher powder make sure its as pure as possible also carbamide peroxide adduct works too.

the proceedure:(couldnt get exact quantities so you have to experiment)
first mix up distilled water and any detergent you purchased then immerse the organ in the solution with some sort of agitation in the form of a speaker to resonate the water at low frequency oscilations (soz experiment that one too) or strong stiring via magnetic stirrer or an aquarium pump to circulate the detergent around for 2 weeks with regular changes to the water every few days.

you should be left out with a grayish whitish organ or tissue after this step next is you need to get your ammonia solution ready and just directly immerse it into it for 1-2 weeks while filtering the solution and recirculating to remove and crud that is dissolved by the alkaline solution and try to prevent escaping ammonia by closing the system or bubbling fresh ammonia/changing the solution.

after the previous step you will be left with a near white but still slightly colored organ, last step is to get your hydrogen peroxide/percarbonate and immerse the part in the solution for 2-3 weeks until it turns bleach white like paper at that point it is done and you have yourself an ECM scaffold of the organ you extracted it from.

dry and powderize to make that powder or thin sheets can be used as grafts.

I grew back a fingertip. No really. I didn't lose as much as this guy but took off a 3 or 4 mm slice with a paper cutter. It was a straight, flat cut but eventually grew back completely, fingerprint and all. This is not unusual because everyone has the ability to grow back the tips of our fingers and toes. We do it the same way as the amphibians. The difference is that they can regrow much more than we can, but this may very well soon change.

This is bogus.  It's been shown for decades that finger tips heal like this.  That was mostly just a skin injury with little flesh anyway.  It would have healed up the same without any treatment.  I've done much worse damage to my index finger with a table saw and it healed up fine and looks just like it did prior.  I basically hollowed out a v-notched groove 1/4" deep into my right index finger including the nail, nail bed and the flesh and skin of the tip and pad.  The Dr clipped off a dangling piece of nail and told me to just let it heal and it would fill in by itself.
